alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Currituck , the southeastern City of Chesapeake and the southeastern City of Virginia Beach through 345 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Knotts Island, or near Currituck, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain could result in ponding of water on roadways. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Corolla around 325 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Barco, Snowden, Aydlett, Sandbridge Beach, Waterlily, Sligo, Munden and Maple. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
